ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .

Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Lily Zeng  I interacted with Lily
Instructor: Lily Zeng  Lily Zeng

Instructor: Lily Zeng  Lily was excellent in explaining the materials that I did not understand during the class. I discussed many times with her when I was doing all of my exercises. She was very helpful and provided many suggestions for my performances during the class.
Instructor: Lily Zeng  Lily Zeng
Instructor: Lily Zeng  Lily Zeng
Instructor: Lily Zeng  Lily Zeng
Instructor: Lily Zeng  Lily Zeng
Instructor: Lily Zeng  Lily Zeng.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The lectures were engaging, but the class was so small it would have benefited from a more round-table discussion. It would have been nice to get to know the other students in the class before the end of the term and the final presentations.
N/A

With this course, you get what you put into it. If you dive into the material and study it, you will get a lot out of it. Chad is a great professor and mentor in the program, and having access to him as a resource through this course is a great benefit. The course itself will not challenge you and you can fly through it unless you choose to delve into the material. Chad's overall purpose for the course is very worthwhile and interesting.

The lectures were interesting and I really enjoyed the class itself, but the first exercise was frustrating without being useful and the final exam was also frustrating and I don't think taught me much.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The course content is great. Lots of resources were discussed and spoken about.Prof Oliver is extremely knowledgeable and super helpful with presentations and exercises. He is also accessible and provides real world knowledge that is great in context.For the exercises, we had a second chance to make up for any mistakes the first time we submitted our work so that was a good learning platform. With feedback, I was able to understand where I had missed key points and able to add that later.
The lectures and PPTs were well prepared and delivered with expertise.

The best aspect of this course was the exercises, particularly the Exercise 2 and 3. Those exercises enabled us to focus on a particular resource and increased our understanding on the resource. I was able to learn the present condition and to make a projection on that resource. The exercises also served as a meaningful learning for presentation.

The part of the course I found most productive were the two required presentations you do on a topic of your choice. It is great to be 'forced' to practice presentation skills and nice to be able to study basically any topic you wish.
Focusing on the future state of a resource
The 2nd and 3rd projects allowed a lot of independent application of your own area of interest.

Despite their dry tone, I really enjoyed the lecture and the overview it gave of global resource issues. Chad's stories are great and really ground the information he is teaching. The final student presentations were really fun to listen to as well.
Able to learn some basic fundamentals of global resources and to some extent how to manage them.

The resource projects were the best part, since we got to explore something deeply on our own and present our findings to the class. It was a really fun project that taught me many things I didn't know, and tested my ability to data mine, present data, and explain it to my peers in a meaningful way. Most students displayed real improvement between their two presentations, which was exciting.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: There could have been one field trip or guest lecturers who could talk about a resource in their research or work experience.The questions for the exams and the theory taught in class had some gaps...basically the questions are more practical and theory is what was taught in class so that difference was sometimes difficult to address.

Clarity of expectations and the fact that much of the work for the course was skewed to the second half of the semester. Would have benefited from understanding of a timeline in advance of the final presentations.
N/A
It is easy to get by doing very little work. Not sure if that is something that can be addressed directly.
The lectures were pretty scattered. The 1st project relied on a terribly organized spreadsheet as a means of teaching database management. This should be cleaned up.

The first exercise was incredibly time consuming and very poorly designed. I thought the data was used was terrible and the questions were often unclear and confusing. The readings were also not useful and did not add anything to the lectures.
I felt the teaching was little fast.

We got off to a bit of a slow start in terms of workload, which made the course a bit heavy on the end since we had a lot to do at the very end of the semester that could've been spread out more over the term.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: There were no discussion groups as such. The exercises and the questions for the exam were the only way of meeting with peers.It was good that we could decide whether we wanted to work in groups or not
They informed one another.
The relationship between the course lectures and the discussion was effective.
N/A
No sections
Yes, they were effective and directly related to the course.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: I thought the Teaching Assistant was not very engaging. Maybe the course was such but she did not contribute inclass and in my other classes that was not the case. While she did have office hours and she did help with assignments there was always double checking with the Teacher which basically meant we were to directly ask Prof Oliver if we had any questions on the assignment.
Instructor: Lily Zeng  She was capable and knowledgeable, but we didn't have that much interaction in class.
Instructor: Lily Zeng  She was great. She understood her materials very well.
Instructor: Lily Zeng  Lily was helpful and approachable
Instructor: Lily Zeng  Very little interaction with the TA. I got very little out of her feedback.
Instructor: Lily Zeng  The TF was useful and available for questions about the assignments.
Instructor: Lily Zeng  She was available anytime outside of her regular schedule and open to explain details. I am happy with how she graded our exercises.
Instructor: Lily Zeng  She was great at explaining why things were how they were, and what you needed to do to improve your work. Overall a nice TF to have.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I think the course was good and it some ways you get to learn about a lot of different things together in one subject which was interesting but that was also a disadvantage because in the end the content was a bit confusing

The course provided me the understanding of the existence and distribution of resources globally. This understanding is important for me because I will be working for the national government. My job requires me to understand how the resources are distributed around the world, what are the key issues, and how to manage them. This course helped me to meet those requirements.
It is a general-knowledge course, but the independent research project was an opportunity to explore a topic I might look into researching further.

I already had course in soil science, agriculture, and water management. However, I learned new things like what are their status and future scenarios; and how they can be managed so that future generations do not run out of resources and starve. I also learned what sustainability is and how it is not appropriate as a term to define our resources.
It allowed me to explore agricultural resource issues that are my main interest, in a way that I might not otherwise have done.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I would like to work with an international organization and understanding the concepts of global resources is always good for such a thing.
Interest in global resource management, though more so from the policy perspective.
I took this course because I found it very interesting to learn about the resources without going deep into the science.
It looked interesting and I wanted to take at least one course with Chad.
I hoped it would give me an in-depth overview of environmental issues that I didn't have much exposure to before.

Although I had taken some of the courses related to topics covered in this course, I wanted to hone my knowledge and further my understanding so that I can effectively utilize myknowledge in the practical situations.
To learn about natural resources on an international scale, and particularly agriculture and its impact on other resources.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
I learned some Excel skills which were very useful!
The knowledge and skills that I gained from the course met my expectations.
No. I got very little out of the course material aside from the presentation assignment.
Yes

I think the knowledge was a little underwhelming in the end as some of the topics were too broad and did not expand my knowledge. Some, like the climate section, was very useful, but others not as much.
Yes, it met my expectations and instructor was good enough to explain to impart the knowledge.

The course exceeded my expectations, since it built up to taking a critical approach to data and information. We learned to not only collect data but to analyze it and understand its strengths, weaknesses, and implications. I learned very much from the work I did in this class, in a way that I was not expecting when the course began.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: we picked our own groups and we worked together during exam week.
Advantage: fruitful discussionDisadvantage: the exercise was not designed as a group work so it was hard to work in a group. We ended up working individually.
The group for project 1 allowed for a great collaborative experience. The group study for the final exam was invaluable.
It helped share some of the workload which for some of the work was a lot.

working in a group helps to share knowledge with each other and clear the doubts we have. however, sometimes it is diffiult to get along with the group when points are not agreed and each try to defend their views.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: To meet with Prof Oliver after classes and learn from his wealth of knowledge. He is terrific
Do not wait until last minute to work on the exercises because they require deep research.
It could be applicable to any FES student.
It was a good easier course if you have a lot of harder courses to counterbalance, but overall not particularly rigorous.

Start reading materials from the beginning of the class to catch up with the instructor. Reading the material given by the instructor is enough and do not need extra materials. It helps if one knows some computation in excel because exercises require the use of excel.

Step outside your comfort zone, research something that is on the edge of your understanding so that you have to really learn. Don't dive into something you are already good at, take a stab at something new and you will learn a lot more.
